de.polygonal.ds.BST

type
class
implements
Collection<T>
A Binary Search Tree (BST).

Constructor

new()

Instance Methods

clear() : Void

Removes all elements from this BST. The tree is cleared recursively, starting from the node on which the method is called.

clone(assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError copier is null: element is not of type Cloneable (if debug flag is set).
Duplicates this BST.
If assign is true the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference. If assign is false and copier is null, the method assumes that all elements implement the Cloneable interface. In this case element.clone() is used for duplicating an element. Otherwise the method uses the copier function.

contains(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this BST contains x.

find(x : T) : BinaryTreeNode<T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Tree is empty or x is invalid (if debug flag is set).
Finds x and returns a reference to the node containing x, or null if no match was found.

insert(x : T) : BinaryTreeNode<T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError x is invalid (if debug flag is set).
Inserts x into the binary search tree and returns a reference to the inserted node.

isEmpty() : Bool

Returns true if this BST is empty.

iterator() : Iterator<T>

Iterates over all elements in this BST.

remove(x : T) : Bool

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError x is invalid (if debug flag is set).
Removes x and returns true if x was successfully removed.

removeNode(x : BinaryTreeNode<T>) : Bool

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError x is invalid (if debug flag is set).
Removes x and returns true if x was successfully removed.

root() : BinaryTreeNode<T>

The root node.

size() : Int

The total number of elements.

toArray(?output : Array<T>) : Array<T>

returns
The output array or a new array if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output array ordered by the preorder rule. The method creates a new array if output is not specified.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object. Prints out all elements if compiled with the -debug flag.

toVector(?output : Vector<T>) : Vector<T>

returns
The output vector or a new vector if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output array ordered by the preorder rule. The method creates a new array if output is not specified.
